what: Helpers for using IDEA colors with ggplot2
title: Helpers for using IDEA colors with ggplot2
text: goal ideacolors simple: ensure graphics generated IDEA Research Analytics R ggplot2 conform IDEA’s Brand Guidelines (2024) providing themes scales. package uses default palette defined 2024 Brand Guidelines document found pages 19-21. Similarly, ideacolors also provides palette defined Camp RIO Branding Guidelines (2022) page 7 visualizations related Camp RIO. point help us innovate content visualizations rather look feel. Indeed, latter important conveying analysis insights familiar way, remains sizzle steak.

title: Helpers for using IDEA colors with ggplot2
text: Since internal package, need install development version GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("idea-analytics/ideacolors")

title: Helpers for using IDEA colors with ggplot2
text: can use scale_idea_colors theme_idea_light  can change qualitative color scale theme_idea_min:  Using Camp RIO branding guidelines similar - instead scale_color_idea() scale_fill_idea(), use scale_color_camp_rio() scale_fill_camp_rio().  Note Camp RIO themes provided - please use theme_idea_min() theme_idea_light() instead.
code: library(ideacolors)  library(tidyverse) #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.4 #> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1 #> ✔ ggplot2   3.5.0     ✔ tibble    3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0 #> ✔ purrr     1.0.2      #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors  p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x=disp, y=mpg)) +   geom_point(aes(color=as_factor(cyl))) +   scale_color_idea(palette = "div") +   theme_idea_light()    p p +    scale_color_idea(palette = "qual") +   theme_idea_min() #> Scale for colour is already present. #> Adding another scale for colour, which will replace the existing scale. p +    scale_color_camp_rio() +   theme_idea_min() #> Scale for colour is already present. #> Adding another scale for colour, which will replace the existing scale.

title: Helpers for using IDEA colors with ggplot2

title: Camp RIO palettes with ramped colors — camp_rio_palette_ramp
text: palette Choose `camp_rio_palettes` list alpha transparency 0 (completely transparent) 1 (completely opaque) reverse `TRUE``, direction color ramp reversed. year Defaults recent branding guidelines (year = 2022)

code: library(scales) show_col(camp_rio_palette_ramp()(10))   filled.contour(volcano,color.palette = camp_rio_palette_ramp(), asp=1)

title: Camp RIO Color Palettes (2022) — camp_rio_palettes_2022

text: object class list length 8.

title: Camp RIO Color Palettes (2022) — camp_rio_palettes_2022
text: list available palettes : * qual * div * blueorange * greenorange * bluegray * greengray * orangegray

title: Camp RIO Color Palettes (2022) — camp_rio_palettes_2022
code: # Make an x-y plot using the div palette library(tidyverse) #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5 #> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1 #> ✔ ggplot2   3.5.0     ✔ tibble    3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1 #> ✔ purrr     1.0.2      #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ readr::col_factor() masks scales::col_factor() #> ✖ purrr::discard()    masks scales::discard() #> ✖ dplyr::filter()     masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()        masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors df <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100, 0, 20),           y = rnorm(100, 0, 20),           cl = sample(letters[1:8], 100, replace=TRUE)) ggplot(df, aes(x, y, colour=cl, shape=cl)) +   geom_point(size=4) +   scale_colour_camp_rio() +   theme_bw() +   theme(aspect.ratio=1) #> Warning: The shape palette can deal with a maximum of 6 discrete values because more #> than 6 becomes difficult to discriminate #> ℹ you have requested 8 values. Consider specifying shapes manually if you need #>   that many have them. #> Warning: Removed 22 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).   # Make a histogram using the qual palette ggplot(df, aes(x, fill=cl)) + geom_histogram() +   scale_fill_camp_rio(palette="qual") #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

title: IDEA palettes with ramped colors — idea_palette_ramp
text: palette Choose `idea_palettes` list alpha transparency 0 (completely transparent) 1 (completely opaque) reverse `TRUE``, direction color ramp reversed. year Defaults recent branding guidelines (year = 2024), year = 2019 also available

title: IDEA palettes with ramped colors — idea_palette_ramp
text: function takes number colors needed argument

title: IDEA palettes with ramped colors — idea_palette_ramp
code: library(scales)  # Defaults to the most recent branding guidelines (2024) show_col(idea_palette_ramp()(10))   # Use the 2019 branding guidelines instead show_col(idea_palette_ramp(year = 2019)(10))   filled.contour(volcano,color.palette = idea_palette_ramp(), asp=1)

title: IDEA Color Palettes (2019) — idea_palettes
code: # Make an x-y plot using the div palette library(tidyverse) df <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100, 0, 20),           y = rnorm(100, 0, 20),           cl = sample(letters[1:8], 100, replace=TRUE)) ggplot(df, aes(x, y, colour=cl, shape=cl)) +   geom_point(size=4) +   scale_colour_idea() +   theme_bw() +   theme(aspect.ratio=1) #> Warning: The shape palette can deal with a maximum of 6 discrete values because more #> than 6 becomes difficult to discriminate #> ℹ you have requested 8 values. Consider specifying shapes manually if you need #>   that many have them. #> Warning: Removed 24 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).   # Make a histogram using the qual palette ggplot(df, aes(x, fill=cl)) + geom_histogram() +   scale_fill_idea(palette="qual") #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

title: IDEA Color Palettes (2024) — idea_palettes_2024
code: # Make an x-y plot using the div palette library(tidyverse) df <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100, 0, 20),           y = rnorm(100, 0, 20),           cl = sample(letters[1:8], 100, replace=TRUE)) ggplot(df, aes(x, y, colour=cl, shape=cl)) +   geom_point(size=4) +   scale_colour_idea() +   theme_bw() +   theme(aspect.ratio=1) #> Warning: The shape palette can deal with a maximum of 6 discrete values because more #> than 6 becomes difficult to discriminate #> ℹ you have requested 8 values. Consider specifying shapes manually if you need #>   that many have them. #> Warning: Removed 34 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).   # Make a histogram using the qual palette ggplot(df, aes(x, fill=cl)) + geom_histogram() +   scale_fill_idea(palette="qual") #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

what: Camp RIO color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_camp_rio
title: Camp RIO color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_camp_rio
text: Camp RIO color scale palette ggplot2

title: Camp RIO color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_camp_rio
code: scale_color_camp_rio(   palette = "div",   discrete = TRUE,   alpha = 1,   reverse = FALSE,   year = 2022,   ... )  scale_colour_camp_rio(   palette = "div",   discrete = TRUE,   alpha = 1,   reverse = FALSE,   year = 2022,   ... )

title: Camp RIO color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_camp_rio
text: palette Choose 'camp_rio_palettes_2022' list discrete whether use discrete color palette alpha transparency reverse logical, Reverse order colours? year Defaults recent branding guidelines (year = 2022) ... additional arguments passed `scale_color_gradientn`

title: Camp RIO color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_camp_rio
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point(aes(colour = factor(cyl))) +   scale_colour_camp_rio(palette="qual")   ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point(aes(colour = hp)) +   scale_colour_camp_rio(palette="qual", discrete = FALSE)   ggplot(data = mpg) +   geom_point(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = class)) +   scale_colour_camp_rio(palette="bluegray")

what: IDEA color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_idea
title: IDEA color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_idea
text: IDEA color scale palette ggplot2

title: IDEA color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_idea
code: scale_color_idea(   palette = "div",   discrete = TRUE,   alpha = 1,   reverse = FALSE,   year = 2024,   ... )  scale_colour_idea(   palette = "div",   discrete = TRUE,   alpha = 1,   reverse = FALSE,   year = 2024,   ... )

title: IDEA color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_idea
text: palette Choose 'idea_palettes' list discrete whether use discrete color palette alpha transparency reverse logical, Reverse order colours? year Defaults recent branding guidelines (year = 2024), year = 2019 also available ... additional arguments passed `scale_color_gradientn`

title: IDEA color scale palette for ggplot2 — scale_color_idea
code: library(ggplot2)  # Explicitly calls the 2024 branding guidelines ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point(aes(colour = factor(cyl))) +   scale_colour_idea(palette="qual", year = 2024)   # Explicitly calls the 2019 branding guidlines ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point(aes(colour = hp)) +   scale_colour_idea(palette="qual", discrete = FALSE, year = 2019)   # Chooses the bluegray palette ggplot(data = mpg) +   geom_point(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = class)) +   scale_colour_idea(palette="bluegray")

title: IDEA fill palette for ggplot2 — scale_fill_camp_rio
text: palette Choose 'idea_palettes' list discrete whether use discrete colour palette alpha alpha transparency, number [0,1], see argument alpha hsv. reverse `TRUE``, direction color ramp reversed. year Defaults recent branding guidelines (year = 2024), year = 2019 also available ... additional arguments pass scale_color_gradientn

title: IDEA fill palette for ggplot2 — scale_fill_camp_rio
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(diamonds) +   geom_bar(aes(x = cut, fill = clarity)) +   scale_fill_camp_rio()
